key_myths.name: Question 1
key_myths.description: If God alone is omnipresent, how can Satan tempt all people everywhere at once?

key_myths.name: Question 3
key_myths.description: Why does Jesus say sin comes from within the human heart (Matthew 15:19), not from external demonic influence?

key_myths.name: Question 4
key_myths.description: Why did God repent of making man because man's heart was evil (Genesis 6:5-6), not repent of making Satan?

key_myths.name: Question 5
key_myths.description: Can you find even one case of demonic possession in the entire Old Testament?

key_myths.name: Question 7
key_myths.description: When Jesus called Peter "Satan" (Matthew 16:23), did He say Peter spoke "the things of men" or "the things of the devil"?

key_myths.name: Question 9
key_myths.description: How can the human heart be "deceitful above all things" (Jeremiah 17:9) if Satan is supposed to be the ultimate deceiver?

key_myths.name: Question 10
key_myths.description: If Christ destroyed "him that had the power of death, that is, the devil" (Hebrews 2:14), why is Satan supposedly still active?

key_myths.name: Question 12
key_myths.description: Is Satan the serpent in Genesis, or was it a beast of the field cursed to crawl on its belly?

key_myths.name: Question 23
key_myths.description: How did King David never write one word about Satan in all the Psalms?

key_myths.name: Question 34
key_myths.description: Why does the Bible say "the carnal mind is enmity against God" (Romans 8:7) instead of Satan?

mythologyStories.intro: Ward's careful analysis reveals that "the Satan" (ha-satan in Hebrew) means "the adversary" or "the accuser" - a role or function, not a personal name. In Job, this figure appears in God's heavenly court as one who tests and accuses, subject entirely to God's authority. The Satan cannot act independently but only as God permits.

name: Tim Ward Biblical Studies - Honoring Deep Scriptural Scholarship
searchTerms: tim ward biblical studies - honoring deep scriptural scholarship
